revised_title: The Cooling Effects of Hydrogen and Its Compounds in Voltaic Ignition
tldr: The author investigates the cooling effects of hydrogen and its compounds in cases of voltaic ignition. He explains that when a coil of platinum wire is connected to an electric battery and immersed in hydrogen, which is a conductor of electricity, the electric matter is abstracted or conducted from every portion of the wire, preventing the commotion that causes ignition and resulting in a cooler wire.
